content:
Did you enter the 'app specific password' in this location:

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Scroll to Passwords section
  • click on 'Saved Passwords'
  • click on 'Show Passwords'
  • For both the incoming line and the smtp outgoing lines
  • Right click on line and select 'Edit PAssword'
  • Completely clear contents and enter the 'app specific password'
  • When both are done click on 'Close'
  • REstart Thunderbird

Do you use any program that can clean up files like CCleaner or WiseCleaner or even some Anti-Virus products can do this ? They have a habit of deleting temp files, session files and password files, so if you want to use those types of programs then please make Thunderbird profile folders exempt from access.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
If the server does not support imap, pop,smtp protocols then it is not allowing email clients to use those normal protocols.

However, there maybe an addon which could help. It is a paid for addon, but the cost is minimal. This addon does get access to exchange for outlook, so may work for you. Please read info at this link: https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/owl-for-exchange/
creator: Toad-Hall

content: I encourage you to pursue the possibility that other software is interrupting the upgrade, such as an antivirus. Either that, or set to be notified when an update is available, and do backup immediately prior. I do understand your frustration, but many thousands upgrade with no problems.

content: Sorry, absolutely not. AV software is not an issue here, it is communication/incompatibility issues with other platforms such as Google and Hotmail, as indicated. I only use Windows built-in security and it is certainly not interfering. This is an ongoing problem for years now.
creator: vion.and.frederique

content: In that case, I encourage you to document the issue in bugzilla.mozilla.org. I do occasionally see issues with Google and Hotmail, but never in a consistent pattern. Please include whatever info you can so people reading the bug will have opportunity to reproduce it. Thank you.

content: Generally, I recommend unsubscribing from AllMail because it has duplicates of all messages in inbox, sent, etc. - and also increases thunderbird overhead of keeping it in sync. To save messages for an IMAP account, and have the full content, I recommend - click account settings>synchronization&storage - click 'advanced' button and mark desired folders for offline use - click File>offline>download sync - now, highlight and COPY the messages you want saved in Local Folders. Do NOT use MOVE.
creator: davidsk

content: - highlight a desired folder - rightclick and select 'properties' - put a tickmark on the entry to check mail for this folder.
creator: davidsk

content:
Looks like you are trying to create a new mail account for an existing email address.

Thunderbird does not create passwords for mail accounts. You have to logon to your webmail account via a browser in order to set up or modify a password.

If you have forgotten the password then there should be a 'Forgotten Password' link to click on. Then follow instructions in order to get access to account at which point you can reset the password. Once you have set up password, you can then use it to create the mail account.

If you already had this mail account set up in Thunderbird then perhaps you instructed Thunderbird to remember the password. In which case check this location:

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Scroll to Passwords section
  • click on 'Saved Passwords'
  • click on 'show Passwords'

Then use that saved password to see if it gains you access to your webmail account. This means you can check to see if the password is correct.
creator: Toad-Hall
